bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, September 21, 1951

div1.p: Hench discusses his upcoming trips and inquires about the date of the next meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, September 21, 1951
div1.opener:
September 21, 1951
Colonel J. F. Siler
3434-34th Place N.W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear Colonel Siler:
div1.p:
It has disappointed me that I was not able to attend last year's meeting
of the Walter Reed Memorial Association. As you know, I had just returned
from one European trip and was preparing to go back to Stockholm.

Because of my absences from the Clinic this year, I will not be able to
make more than one more trip away from the Clinic. I must speak in
New York on October 11, in Pittsburgh on October 18 and between that
time will be visiting my son at New Haven (Yale Medical School) and my
daughter at Wellesley. Because of this trip, I will not be able to
go east during November. I wondered whether you were planning to have
a meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association in November and whether
any items were coming up that should require my presence. If there are
any important things being brought up and if you do want me, would it
be just as convenient to have the meeting in October? The only day that
I could conveniently come to Washington would be Wednesday, October 17.
I could leave Boston the evening of the 16th, get to Washington the morning
of the 17th, and leave that evening for Pittsburgh.

I myself have no special items to bring up at present. I have helped
several writers recently who were writing something in connection with
Walter Reed's 100th birthday, among them Mrs. Mary Standlee of the Walter
Reed Hospital, and more recently a New York physician who arranged some
sort of a Walter Reed celebration at Bellevue Hospital.

Mrs. Hench and I are going again to Cuba in January and I hope during my
visit to try once more to revive the Cubans' plans to protect Walter Reed's
Building No. 1. Until I go there in January, I will have nothing to report
to the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

If you believe that it is not necessary for me to come this fall and if you
prefer to have the meeting in November, that will be certainly all right
with me. I would appreciate it greatly if you would telegraph me collect
on receipt of this letter so that I can make my pullman connections either
from Boston directly to Pittsburgh, or from Boston by way of Washington.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
